intro.description:
This tutorial will demonstrate how to turn the Eclipse Browser plug-in into a minimal RCP application.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the plug-in manifest editor
item.description:
To open the plug-in manifest editor (if it is not already open), expand the org.eclipse.browser tree in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the plugin.xml file.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task:

item.title: Define an application extension
item.description: To define an application extension, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: On the "Extensions" page of the plug-in manifest editor, press the "Add..." button to open the "New Extension" wizard.
Select "org.eclipse.core.runtime.applications" from the "Extension Points" list box and press "Finish".
In the "Extension Details" section, set the contents of the "ID" field to "application"
Right-click on the "org.eclipse.core.runtime.applications" node in the "All Extensions" section and select "New->application" from the context menu.
Right-click on the "(application)" node in the "All Extensions" section and select "New->run" from the context menu.
Replace the content of the "class" text box with "org.eclipse.browser.application.Application".

item.title: Run the application
item.description: To run the RCP application, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: On the "Overview" page of the plug-in manifest editor, click the "Launch an Eclipse application" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading to launch the RCP application.
Note the standalone window containing File and Help menus, and the Eclipse Browser view occupies the entire window area. This is your minimal RCP application.
Select "File->Exit" from the main menu to exit the application.
